title: Folic Acid (Albro) 5MG Tab 5x20 (L)
details: It is used to treat folic acid deficiency and certain types of anemia (lack of red blood cells) caused by folic acid deficiency.
precautions: Use with caution in undiagnosed anemias. Taking folic acid might mask anemia caused by vitamin B12 deficiency and delay appropriate treatment. Taking folic acid supplements might make seizures worse in people with seizure disorders, particularly in high doses.
effects: Headache, Unpleasant taste, upset stomach may occur.

effects: Headache, Unpleasant taste, upset stomach may occur.

title: Folifur 60ML Syp
details: It's an iron supplement that is used for the treatment and prevention of anemia caused by iron deficiency.
precautions: Keep it out of the reach of the children. Store it in a cool and dry place.
effects: No side effects are reported. Consult a doctor if it causes digestive problems i.e. gas, bloating, abdominal pain, GERD (gastroesophageal reflux disease), vomiting, nausea, or diarrhea, etc.

formula:
Iron Polymaltose and Folic Acid
Barrett
details: This medication is an iron supplement used to treat or prevent low blood levels of iron such as those caused by Anemia or Pregnancy.
precautions: Tell your doctor/Pharmacist your medical history, especially of Use/Abuse of alcohol, Liver problems, Stomach/Intestinal problems, e.g., Ulcer, Colitis. Be sure to tell your doctor/Pharmacist if you Pernicious anemia before taking it. Folic acid may falsely improve certain laboratory tests for vitamin B12 deficiency without actually treating this anemia.
effects: Constipation, Diarrhea, Stomach cramps, or Upset stomach may occur.

precautions: If a person has a severe illness like Hemolytic anemia or hemochromatosis, it is not recommended to take this syrup.Do not give this syrup to any child without medical advice.While pregnancy or nursing, this syrup is used with the doctor's advice.Always take this syrup on an empty stomach.Read and carefully follow the instructions provided with the syrup.Always take the doctor's advice while taking this syrup to treat iron deficiency or anemia.Always store ironone syrup at room temperature.Keep this syrup out of reach of children.Consult your doctor/Pharmacist if you have, Hemochromatosis, Hemosiderosis. title: Trihemic 600MG Tab 3x10 (L)
formula:

Hinucon
details:
Trihemic tablet is to fulfil your multivitamin and iron requirements. It contains several important vitamins, minerals and iron that are essential for our body. It fulfils the requirement of the certain nutrients that are not present in our diet.

READ MORE
precautions: Before taking this medication, go for lab tests to check if you have vitamin or iron deficiency.Limit your exposure to sunlight because these tablets can make your skin sensitive to the skin. This medication provides necessary nutrients that provide essential benefits to the human body. It is advised to take the medication for a certain period. title: Ferrium 120ML Syp
details: Indicated for the treatment of iron and folate deficiency. Iron deficiency may lead to low blood count disease (anemia). It increases red blood cells production and reduces lethargy, weakness, and low energy.
precautions: Keep out of the reach of children. Store at room temperature, i.e. below 30 degrees Celsius. Protect from heat, humidity, or direct exposure to sunlight. Avoid it if you're hypersensitive to any of its ingredients.
effects: It rarely causes any kinds of adverse reactions. Side effects may include digestive problems, i.e. vomiting, nausea, diarrhea, constipation, abdominal cramps, GERD (gastroesophageal reflux disease), heartburn, feeling of sickness, etc. Others are loss of appetite, drowsiness, headache, skin allergies, swelling, vision disorders, etc. Consult a doctor or seek a healthcare provider in case of any adverse reaction.

precautions: Before using the product, you must consult a doctor or perform certain tests to check whether you are iron deficient or not and if you need to add this product in your diet or not because excessive iron can be harmful too.In case you are anaemic, and you use this product to overcome the efficiency, then you must ensure that the product is actually working by keeping in check the haemoglobin levels.  It may increase the blood sugar levels in some patients. Individuals with diabetes must use this product on doctor's consultations only. Pregnant women must use this product only on doctor’s consultation just to avoid the risk that it may pose to the unborn child. Breastfeeding mothers should also use this product only on doctor's prescription because it may not be suitable for the baby, and since it can pass onto the baby through breast milk, it can be harmful for the little one.Do not use the expired product. title: Maltofer 120ML Syp
details:
Maltofer syrup is used to treat iron deficiency. It can be used by adults as well as children. It can also be used by individuals that are iron intolerant. Iron is essential for the oxygen-carrying capacity of hemoglobin. It is a necessary elemen

READ MORE
precautions: Inform the doctor about if you have any tumors, allergies or infections, or any other underlying issue; before taking this medication.Inform the doctor if you are pregnant or a breast-feeding mother.Check the list of ingredients in the leaflet to avoid the risk of any allergic reaction due to any active or inactive substance.Do not take it if you have anemia, but it is not due to the deficiency of iron.If you do not have iron deficiency, then do not take it.It is not considered safe for children under age 12.This product is not to be consumed by infants.Check the date of expiry before taking the medication.Contraindicated in Hemochromatosis, Hemolytic anemia, Inflammatory bowl disease, Sidero-achrestic anemia, Thalassemia, Hypersensitivity to iron. Discontinue if symptoms of intolerance appear.
effects: This medication does not have any serious side effects if taken after a thorough check-up. However, oftentimes people assume that they are suffering from iron deficiency and start taking the medication without getting checked. This can be problematic because this may lead to an excess of iron in the body, and excess iron is as bad as the deficiency. Excessive amounts of iron in the body can cause serious allergies. Irritable bowel syndrome such as diarrhea is quite a common side-effect of iron supplements. Also, the stool may appear darker in color than usual. This is due to iron, and it is perfectly common. In case the situation does not go away after few days, stop taking medicine and seek medical assistance. Dizziness, Nausea, Stomach upset, Constipation, Sweating, Taste disturbance, Sense of repletion, Black colored faeces, Tooth discoloration, Joint and muscle pain may occur.

precautions: Maltofer tablet precautions are the following.Before taking the Maltofer tablet, inform the doctor About your medical condition. Also, inform if you are taking any medicine or any other herbal supplement at the same time.If you have any allergic problem from any of the ingredients used in this medicine, such as skin allergy, skin rashes, itching, etc.If you are suffering from asthma, or wheezing, shortness of breath, or difficulty in breathing.If you have to swell on the different parts of the body, such as lips, tongue, and face.If you have an iron digestion problem or you are overload with iron but have a problem in the utilization of iron.If you are suffering from an infection or tumour.You are pregnant or a nursing mother.Suffering from any other health issue.Avoid changing the Maltofer tablet dosage unless the doctor suggests you.Do not stop taking it before its course completes.If the Maltofer tablets are affecting sleepiness and causing dizziness, drowsiness, or some other serious side effect, then avoid driving or using the heavy machinery that needs mental alertness.Taking the Maltofer tablets in pregnancy is good; however, taking suggestions from the doctor is necessary.Keep the medicine away from children and pet’s reach.Tell your doctor/Pharmacist your medical history, especially of Use/Abuse of alcohol, Liver problems, Stomach/Intestinal problems, e.g., Ulcer, Colitis. Be sure to tell your doctor/Pharmacist if you Pernicious anemia before taking it. Folic acid may falsely improve certain laboratory tests for vitamin B12 deficiency without actually treating this anemia.
effects: The possible side effects of Maltofer tablets are the following,The common side effects Maltofer cause is:Diarrhea, nausea, constipation, indigestion, and abdominal pain. It can also cause discomfort or bloating.The uncommon side effects caused by Maltofer are:Vomiting, discoloration of teeth, itching, hives, and headache.Allergic reaction in the form of skin rashes, redness of the skin, itching, swelling, etc.Gastritis problems.The rare side effects caused by the Maltofer are:Pain in the muscles or muscle spasms.It also causes contraction.Constipation, Diarrhea, Stomach cramps, or Upset stomach may occur.

title: Foliday 600MCG Tab 3x10 (L)
details: It is used to treat folic acid deficiency and certain types of anemia (lack of red blood cells) caused by folic acid deficiency.
precautions: Use with caution in undiagnosed anemias. Taking folic acid might mask anemia caused by vitamin B12 deficiency and delay appropriate treatment. Taking folic acid supplements might make seizures worse in people with seizure disorders, particularly in high doses.
effects: Headache, Unpleasant taste, upset stomach may occur.

effects: It rarely causes any kinds of adverse reactions. Side effects may include digestive problems, i.e. vomiting, nausea, diarrhea, constipation, abdominal cramps, GERD (gastroesophageal reflux disease), heartburn, feeling of sickness, etc. Others are loss of appetite, drowsiness, headache, skin allergies, swelling, vision disorders, etc. Consult a doctor or seek a healthcare provider in case of any adverse reaction.

precautions: Your stool changes color during taking Iron medicine and the color change into black and it is not harmful or dangerous for your health.Take the medicine at the same time each day in order to remember. In order to get the benefit to taking the medication regularly.If you are allergic to any drug or any other elements present in the medicine then before starting it, tell you doctor or pharmacist about your allergy problem because this product have some inactive ingredients which can cause allergy or some other harmful effects.There is no risk-taking this drug during pregnancy.Liquid iron may blacken your teeth.Discuss with your doctor or pharmacist, if you using any herbal medication prescript or non-prescript like methyldopa, chloramphenicol, or some other nutritional or vitamin medicine before starting this medicine.The medicine is not given to breastfeeding women unless it is necessary. Discuss with a doctor before using it.If a patient suffering from any liver disease, the drug have to use with great care due to the larger risk of severe effects on patient health. A complete checkup of liver function is needed before starting this medicine. Suitable dose accommodation or replacement with a suitable alternative may be required in some cases based on the clinical condition.The medicine is not recommended for children below 2 years of age for the safety of children for this age and has no clinical experience.This medicine may lower blood pressure and hence should be used with extreme caution in patients with hypotension, since it may worsen the patient's condition. Always checkup of blood pressure of the patient while using this medicine. If any side effects are noted during course time medicine dose can be changed or adjusted.This medication should be used only when clearly needed during pregnancy. Tell your doctor/Pharmacist if you are allergic to it or if you have any other allergies.

title: Venofer 5ML Inj 1x5 (L)
details:
Venofer injection is basically an iron source. It makes up the iron deficiency in patients having numerous iron-related diseases. As everyone knows, blood contains haemoglobin, and that haemoglobin is made up of iron. So, we can say that def

READ MORE
precautions: Some hypersensitivity reactions that include anaphylactic-type reactions, some of which have been life-threatening, have been reported while receiving Venofer injection.If any hypersensitivity type symptoms begin to be recorded in the patient during the injection, stop the infusion immediately. During pregnancy, venofer injection should only be taken when compulsory and advised and monitored by the doctor. But if the pregnant woman has IDA, the outcomes are worse. It can cause post-partum anemia. It also causes the babies to be born earlier than 9 months, and those babies are very weak with a small weight.
effects: Venofer injection side effects include pain in muscles, feeling sick, being sick, change of taste in the mouth, loose motions, pain in the head, pain in the back, and drowsiness. These are some symptoms; if they persist, consult your doctor immediately.Some other side effects include severe dizziness, and fainting while receiving the injection. That is why this injection is given slowly. The side effects that need to be informed immediately to the doctor are stomach pain, pain in the heart area, heartbeat not regular, migraine, and eyes getting blurred.

title: Ferinject 10ML Inj 1x1 (P)
details: Ferinject injection is a prescribed medication that is composed of ferric carboxymaltose. It helps in the production of red blood cells.Ferinject injection works by producing the red blood cells to restore iron storage in the body. Iron helps to mak READ MORE
precautions: Consult a doctor, if you're hypersensitive to any of its ingredients. Keep out of the reach of children. Protect from direct exposure to sunlight, and heat. Store below the room temperature.
effects: Ferinject injection side effects are listed below.The side effects of Ferinject injection include the temporary high blood pressure problem.It can cause dizziness, drowsiness, nausea, and redness of the skin. But maybe these side effects disappear after a half or an hour.It can also cause headaches, muscle pain, and hypertension.Ferinject injection can cause decreased phosphate level, also known as hypophosphatemia.This list may be no contains all the side effects caused by Ferinject injection. Thus, to know more details about this product, consult the doctor.Before using this medication, tell your doctor or pharmacist of all prescription and nonprescription/herbal products you may use, especially of aliskiren, lithium, drugs that may increase the level of potassium in the blood (such as ACE inhibitors including benazepril/lisinopril, birth control pills containing drospirenone).
